column1: FIGURE 04: Landslide Red Alerts, as of 1000 hours 24 September 2019
Red Alerts denote that since the rainfall within the past 24 hours has exceeded 150 mm in the area, if the rains continue, it is
advised to the population to evacuate to a safe location to avoid the risk of landslides, slope failures, rock falls, cutting failures
In addition to the nine areas facing a Red alert, there are 14 areas that have been issued a Yellow Alert (75mm) and one area
that has been issued an Orange Alert (100mm).
